intro: Lobelia maranguensis, commonly known as the Marangu lobelias, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tanzania. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool and humid conditions. Its leaves are often lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and sometimes branched. Lobelia maranguensis plays an important role in its ecosystem, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its native range.
